--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0139 b) Date of Occurrence: 18/06/2023
c) Installation Details: Wasp Interceptor - AC-6733-744 at
Forward Operating Base-1
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Electrical b) Date Component 27/06/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Generator Control d) Main Assembly: Wing Root Port
e) Nomenclature: Generator Control Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: EL-2309-Z9 h) Sl No.: SN-5305-755
i) Firmware Version: FW-5.19.3 j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 06/06/2023 l) Date of Removal: 24/06/2023
Pg No: 83 Ln No: 19 Pg No: 89 Ln No: 21
m) Manufacturing Agency: Stellar Avionics Ltd n) Date, Month & Year June 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 1534 Hrs / 1501 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Wiring harness insulation breakdown. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Improper calibration during last maintenance cycle
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Generator Control component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement quality control check at manufacturing stage
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 04/07/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. K.N. Iyer

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility.
Date: 07/07/2023 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 08/07/2023 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 08/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 13/07/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
